byline.contributor: Ashley Parker contributed reporting from Turnberry, Scotland; Gaia Pianigiani from Rome; and Milan Schreuer from Paris.

abstract: Great Britain's vote to leave European Union highlights power of disaffected voters and prompts calls from other nations to leave bloc; exit is uncharted territory for European Union, which has always moved forward, expanding in both size and influence.
lead_paragraph: Britain’s vote to leave the European Union brings into focus the power of disaffected voters to force change on a reluctant establishment.

headline.main: Populist Anger Upends Politics on Both Sides of the Atlantic
headline.print_headline: Strength of Populist Revolt Is Felt on Both Sides of the Atlantic

snippet: Britain’s vote to leave the European Union brings into focus the power of disaffected voters to force change on a reluctant establishment.
